raw_text:
Spector facing more legal action
 
 Music producer Phil Spector is facing legal action from the mother of the actress he has been accused of killing.
 
 Donna Clarkson, whose daughter Lana was found dead in Mr Spector's home in February 2003, is seeking unspecified damages in a civil action. The legal action accuses Mr Spector of murdering the actress at his LA home. Mr Spector is currently free on $1m (£535,000) bail and is awaiting trial. The 64-year-old has denied the killing, saying her death was accidental.
 
 Ms Clarkson's legal action, filed in Los Angeles Superior Court, also accuses Mr Spector of negligence and battery, alleging he "grabbed, hit, fought with and restrained" Lana Clarkson before shooting her to death. Her lawyers said in a statement: "The Clarkson family had hoped that there would be some resolution with regard to the criminal proceedings before moving forward with the civil action. "However, Ms Clarkson and her family understand that the fair administration of justice takes time and in light of the numerous changes Mr Spector has made in his legal defence team over the last two years, Ms Clarkson was forced to file the action before (the statute of limitations expired) on 3 February 2005." Mr Spector, known for his work with the Beatles, has claimed that Lana Clarkson committed suicide. His lawyers, led by Bruce Cutler, have vowed to prove him innocent at trial.
 
 Mr Cutler said: "Phil did not cause the death of this woman, he's not criminally responsible and he's not civilly responsible either. "But I'm not surprised they filed a suit for money, that seems to be de rigueur nowadays." A Los Angeles Superior Court judge is expected to set a trial date later this month for Spector, who was indicted on murder charges in September. Roderick Lindblom, one of Ms Clarkson's lawyers, said: "Our intent is to let the criminal proceedings go forward and not do anything that would interfere with the prosecution."
llama3.2:1b: Phil Spector is facing legal action from his mother Donna Clarkson over Lana Clarkson's death in 2003. Clarkson alleges Spector murdered her at his home, claiming she shot herself after being grabbed, hit, fought with, and restrained by him before a fatal gunshot wound was inflicted. Spector claims the death was accidental and denies any involvement. The legal action seeks unspecified damages, including negligence and battery charges. A Los Angeles Superior Court judge is set to determine a trial date for Spector later this month.
llama3.2:3b: Phil Spector faces legal action from Lana Clarkson's mother Donna Clarkson in a civil case seeking unspecified damages, alleging negligence and battery. Spector denies killing Clarkson, who was found dead at his LA home in 2003, and claims she committed suicide. His lawyers vow to prove him innocent at trial, which is expected to set a date later this month after he was indicted on murder charges.
gemma2:2b: Phil Spector faces civil action from the mother of Lana Clarkson, who died in his home in 2003.  The mother, Donna Clarkson, alleges Mr. Spector murdered her daughter and accuses him of negligence and battery. The lawsuit was filed after a statute of limitations expiration and despite attempts for resolution with criminal proceedings. Ms. Clarkson's legal team intends to allow the criminal case to proceed while also pursuing this civil action. Mr. Spector maintains his innocence and claims Ms. Clarkson committed suicide.
qwen2.5:0.5b: A judge has ordered a trial of Phil Spector accused of murdering his daughter Lana.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Music producer Phil Spector faces more legal action from Donna Clarkson, mother of actress Lana Clarkson killed by him in 2003. Clarkson seeks unspecified damages for civil negligence charges against Spector and alleges he held her before shooting her to death. He denies murder but claims she committed suicide. Clarkson's suit expires February 2005 after new defense team changed tactics.
qwen2.5:3b: Phil Spector faces legal action from Donna Clarkson, mother of deceased actress Lana, seeking unspecified damages for her daughter's murder. Spector denies the killing, claiming it was accidental. The civil suit accuses him of negligence, battery, and alleges he physically abused his victim before her death. The case has been delayed due to changes in Spector’s legal team and statute of limitations concerns. Mr. Spector claims the death was an accident and vows to prove his innocence at trial. A court judge is expected to set a date for Spector's trial later this month, with prosecutors intending to proceed with criminal proceedings without interference from the civil case.
opencoder:1.5b:
The output should be a concise summary of the provided text:

"Phil Spector's legal action against his mother Lana, who was found dead in Mr Spector's LA home after February 2003. According to the court case, Mr Spector, known for his musical performance with The Beatles, committed suicide due to an accident."
smollm:1.7b: Spector facing more legal action for killing Lana Clarkson

First, Phil Spector is facing legal action due to the mother of his actress, Donna Clarkson, who was found dead in his home around 2003. She's seeking unspecified damages for a civil case accusing him of murder via negligence and battery. Spector is on bail with $1 million bailload but hasn't been proven innocent yet.

Spector has worked with the Beatles and claims he didn't kill her, while his lawyer, Bruce Cutler, is vowing to prove him innocent at trial.

Ms Clarkson's case was dismissed because she filed it before the statute of limitations expired in 2005. The judge expects a trial date next month after being indicted on murder charges.

Roderick Lindblom is her lawyer and wants to avoid interfering with the prosecution, so he emphasizes letting the case proceed forward.

I should focus on key points: Spector's legal issues, the defendant's claim against him, his credentials, the case details, and his lawyers' stance. I need to make sure all important details are included without being too detailed.

I also notice that there are multiple mentions of Donna Clarkson's family trying to resolve the issue before proceeding with the civil action, which is a key point in Spector's case. This shows their efforts to prevent the suit from failing quickly.

Putting it all together, I can structure the summary to include each main point: Spector facing legal action, the defendant's claim, his background and claims, her legal action details, her lawyers' approach, and the judge's involvement.
</think>

Phil Spector is facing legal action against Donna Clarkson, who was found dead in his home around 2003. She seeks unspecified damages for a civil case accusing him of murder via negligence and battery, despite claiming it was accidental. Spector, known for his work with the Beatles, has denied responsibility but remains on bail with $1 million bailload. His lawyers, led by Bruce Cutler, aim to prove him innocent at trial. Ms Clarkson's case was dismissed before the statute of limitations expired in 2005 due to her efforts to avoid a potential failure. A judge expects a trial date next month after being indicted on murder charges. Roderick Lindblom is her lawyer and emphasizes letting the case proceed without interfering with the prosecution.
